Name: Part of an animal-shaped inlay
Description: Light blue glass figure of a lion's body in two dimensions, presumably as an inlay. The figure is curved with a convex surface and underside. It recalls the glass hieroglyphic inlays of the Ptolemaic Period, and might be part of a composite sphinx or lion figure, the head being in glass of a different colour. The fine quality is characteristic of the best Ptolemaic work.
